schema.description: The information about the convenience user.

items.description: Details of the convenience user.

EndUserId.description: The username of the convenience user. The name can contain lowercase letters, digits, and underscores (\_), and must be 3 to 24 characters in length.

Email.description: The email address of the convenience user. The email address is used to receive notifications about events such as desktop assignment. You must specify an email address or a mobile number to receive notifications.

Phone.description: Mobile numbers are not supported on the international site (alibabacloud.com).

Password.description:
The user password.

>  The password must be at least 10 characters in length and contain at least three of the following character types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters (excluding spaces).

OwnerType.description:
The type of the account ownership.

Valid values:

*   CreateFromManager: administrator-activated
*   Normal: user-activated

OrgId.description: The organization to which the convenience user belongs.

Remark.description: The remarks on the convenience user.

RealNickName.description: The display name of the end user.

schema.description: The initial password. If this parameter is left empty, an email for password reset is sent to the specified email address.
The date on which the convenience users are automatically locked.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The information that is returned.

CreatedUsers.description: Details of the created convenience users.

items.description: Details of the created convenience user.

EndUserId.description: The name of the end user.

Email.description: The email address of the end user.

Phone.description: The mobile number of the end user.

Remark.description: The remarks of the end user.

RealNickName.description: The display name of the end user.

FailedUsers.description: Details of the convenience users that failed to be created.

items.description: Details of the convenience user that failed to be created.

EndUserId.description: The name of the end user.

Email.description: The email address of the end user.

Phone.description: The mobile number of the end user.

ErrorCode.description: The error code returned if the request failed.

ErrorMessage.example: The username test is used by another user.

CreateUsers.title: CreateUsers
CreateUsers.description: Convenience users are dedicated Elastic Desktop Service (EDS) user accounts and are suitable for scenarios in which you do not need to connect to enterprise Active Directory (AD) systems. The information about a convenience user includes the username, email address, and mobile number. You must specify the username or email address.

RemoveUsers.summary: Removes one or more convenience users.

schema.description: The usernames of the convenience users that you want to remove.

items.description: The username of the convenience user that you want to remove. You can call the [DescribeUsers](~~DescribeUsers~~) operation to query the username.

RemoveUsersResult.description: The result of removing the convenience user.

RemovedUsers.description: The convenience users that were removed.

items.description: The convenience user that was removed.

FailedUsers.description: The convenience users that failed to be removed.

items.description: The convenience user that failed to be removed.

EndUserId.description: The ID of the convenience user that failed to be removed.

RemoveUsers.title: RemoveUsers

schema.description: The name of the user.

The email address of the convenience user. For a user-activated convenience user, the email address or mobile number must be verified. You can choose to verify the email address or the mobile number. For an administrator-activated convenience user, the email address and mobile number can be left empty.

The mobile number of the convenience user. For a user-activated convenience user, the email address or mobile number must be verified. You can choose to verify the email address or the mobile number. For an administrator-activated convenience user, the email address and mobile number can be left empty.

>  Accounts created on the International site (alibabacloud.com) do not support mobile number-based authentication.

ResetUserPassword.summary: Resets the password for a convenience user. If you call this operation, a token that is used to reset the password is generated, and the system sends a password reset email that includes the token to the email address of the convenience user.

schema.description: The names of the convenience users whose passwords you want to reset.

items.description: The name of the convenience user whose password you want to reset.

schema.description:
The method to notify the user after the password is reset.

> Alibaba Cloud accounts of the international site do not support sending notification through text messages.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The information that is returned.

ResetUsersResult.description: The result of resetting the password of the convenience user.

ResetUsers.description: The convenience users to which the system sent a password reset email.

items.description: The convenience user to which the system sent a password reset email.

FailedUsers.description: The information about the convenience users whose passwords failed to be reset.

items.description: The information about the convenience user whose password failed to be reset.

EndUserId.description: The ID of the convenience user whose password failed to be reset.

ResetUserPassword.title: ResetUserPassword

LockUsers.summary: Locks one or more convenience users.

schema.description: The usernames of the convenience users that you want to lock.

items.description: The username of the convenience user that you want to lock.

LockUsersResult.description: The result of the locking the convenience user.

LockedUsers.description: The convenience users that were locked.

items.description: The convenience user that was locked.

FailedUsers.description: The convenience users that failed to be locked.

items.description: The convenience user that failed to be locked.

EndUserId.description: The ID of the convenience user that failed to be locked.

LockUsers.title: LockUsers

UnlockUsers.summary: Unlocks one or more convenience users.

schema.description: The usernames of the convenience users that you want to unlock.

items.description: The username of the convenience user that you want to unlock.

schema.description: The date on which the convenience users are automatically locked.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The information that is returned.

UnlockUsersResult.description: The result of unlocking the convenience user.

UnlockedUsers.description: The convenience users that were unlocked.

items.description: The convenience user that was unlocked.

FailedUsers.description: The convenience users that failed to be unlocked.

items.description: The convenience user that failed to be unlocked.

EndUserId.description: The ID of the convenience user that failed to be unlocked.

UnlockUsers.title: UnlockUsers

DescribeUsers.summary: Queries the information about convenience users. The information of a convenience user includes a username, an email address, and a description.

schema.description:
The maximum number of entries per page.

*   Valid values: 1 to 500.
*   Default value: 500.

The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request.\
If not all results are returned in a query, a value is returned for the NextToken parameter. In this case, you can use the return value of NextToken to perform the next query.

The string that is used for fuzzy search. You perform fuzzy search by username (EndUserId) and email address (Email). Wildcard characters (\*) are supported. For example, if you set this parameter to `a*m`, usernames or email addresses that start with `a` and end with `m` are returned.
The usernames that must be exactly matched.

items.description: The username that must be exactly matched.

schema.description: The usernames that must be exactly excluded.

items.description: The username that must be exactly excluded.

schema.description: The ID of the organization in which you want to query users.
The ID of the organization in which you want to query convenience users.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response parameters.

NextToken.description: The token that determines the start point of the next query. If this parameter is left empty, all results are returned.

items.description: The convenience account.

Id.description: The ID of the convenience user.

EndUserId.description: The username of the convenience user.

Email.description: The email address of the convenience user.

Phone.description: The mobile number of the convenience user. If you leave this parameter empty, the value of this parameter is not returned.

Status.description:
The status of the convenience user.

Valid values:

*   0: The convenience user is normal.

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

*   9: The convenience user is locked.

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

OwnerType.description:
The type of the convenience account.

*   Administrator-activated type: The administrator specifies the username and password of the convenience account. User notifications such as password reset notifications are sent to the email address or mobile number of the administrator.
*   User-activated type: The administrator specifies the username and the email address or mobile number of a convenience user. Notifications such as activation notifications that contain the default password are sent to the email address or mobile number of the convenience user.

Valid values:

*   CreateFromManager

    <!-- -->

    :

    <!-- -->

    administrator-activated

    <!-- -->

*   Normal

    <!-- -->

    :

    <!-- -->

    user-activated

    <!-- -->

Remark.description: The remarks on the convenience user.

OrgId.description:
The ID of the organization to which the convenience user belongs.

>  This parameter will be deprecated in the future.

WyId.description: The globally unique ID of the convenience user.

IsTenantManager.description: Indicates whether the convenience user is an administrator. If the convenience user is of the administrator-activated type, you must specify a user administrator. Notifications such as password reset on a client are sent to the email address or mobile number of the user administrator. For more information, see [Create a convenience user](~~214472~~).

Groups.description: The user groups to which the convenience user belongs.

GroupId.description: The ID of the user group.

GroupName.description: The name of the user group.

Orgs.description: The organizations to which the convenience user belongs.

Avatar.description: The profile picture of the convenience user.

Address.description: The work address of the convenience user.

NickName.description: The nickname of the convenience user.

JobNumber.description: The employee number of the convenience user.

schema.description: The number of entries per page. If you set this parameter to a value greater than 100, the system resets the value to 100.

The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. You do not need to specify this parameter for the first request. If not all results are returned in a query, a value is returned for the NextToken parameter. In this case, you can use the returned NextToken value to start the next query.

The string that is used for fuzzy search. You can use usernames and email addresses to perform fuzzy search. Wildcard characters (\*) are supported for this parameter. For example, if you set this parameter to a\*m, the usernames or an email addresses that start with a or end with m are returned.
The list of properties for fuzzy search.

RealNickName.description: The nickname of the convenience user.

PasswordExpireDays.description:
By default, user account passwords do not expire. However, you can set a validity period between 30 and 365 days. Once the period expires, end users must change their password before they can log on to terminals.

>  The feature is in invitational preview. If you want to use this feature, submit a ticket.

PasswordExpireRestDays.description: The number of days remaining until the account password expires.

CreateProperty.responseDemo:
[{"type":"json","example":"{
  "RequestId": "1CBAFFAB-B697-4049-A9B1-67E1FC5F****",
  "CreateResult": {
    "PropertyId": 390,
    "PropertyKey": "department",
    "SavePropertyValueModel": {
      "SavePropertyValues": [
        {
          "PropertyValueId": 978,
          "PropertyValue": "HR"
        }
      ],
      "FailedPropertyValues": [
        {
          "PropertyId": 390,
          "PropertyValue": "HR",
          "ErrorCode": "ExistedPropertyValue",
          "ErrorMessage": "The property value is used by another property."
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}","errorExample":""},{"type":"xml","example":"<CreatePropertyResponse>
    <RequestId>499B0E01-8AE3-5099-95CE-E69CF4DBE177</RequestId>
    <CreateResult>
        <PropertyId>390</PropertyId>
        <PropertyKey>department</PropertyKey>
        <SavePropertyValueModel>
            <SavePropertyValues>
                <PropertyValueId>978</PropertyValueId>
                <PropertyValue>HR</PropertyValue>
            </SavePropertyValues>
            <FailedPropertyValues>
                <PropertyId>390</PropertyId>
                <PropertyValue>HR</PropertyValue>
                <ErrorCode>ExistedPropertyValue</ErrorCode>
                <ErrorMessage>property value is used by other property</ErrorMessage>
            </FailedPropertyValues>
        </SavePropertyValueModel>
    </CreateResult>
</CreatePropertyResponse>","errorExample":""}]

DescribeOrgs.description: An organization is in a tree structure. The root organization ID is in the following format: org-aliyun-wy-org-id.

RemoveMfaDevice.summary: Removes a virtual multi-factor authentication (MFA) device that is bound to a convenience user.

schema.description: The serial number of the virtual MFA device. The serial number is unique for each device.
The domain of the Active Directory (AD) workspace.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response parameters.

RemoveMfaDevice.title: RemoveMfaDevice
RemoveMfaDevice.description: If you remove a virtual MFA device that is bound to a convenience user, the convenience user can no longer use the virtual MFA device to log on to cloud desktops. Before the convenience user can log on to cloud desktops again, a new virtual MFA device must be bound to the convenience user.

LockMfaDevice.summary: Locks a virtual multi-factor authentication (MFA) device that is bound to a convenience user.

schema.description: The serial number of the virtual MFA device. The serial number is unique for each device.
The domain of the Active Directory (AD) workspace.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response parameters.

LockMfaDevice.title: LockMfaDevice
LockMfaDevice.description: After a virtual MFA device is locked, the status of the virtual MFA device changes to LOCKED. The convenience user to which the MFA device is bound cannot log on to the cloud desktop that resides in the workspace with the MFA feature enabled because the identity of the convenience user cannot be verified based on the virtual MFA device. You can call the [UnlockMfaDevice](~~286534~~) operation to unlock the virtual MFA device.

UnlockMfaDevice.summary: Unlocks a virtual multi-factor authentication (MFA) device that is bound to a convenience user.

schema.description: The serial number of the virtual MFA device. The serial number is unique for each device.
The domain of the Active Directory (AD) workspace.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response parameters.

UnlockMfaDevice.title: UnlockMfaDevice

DescribeMfaDevices.summary: Queries the information about virtual multi-factor authentication (MFA) devices that are bound to convenience users.

schema.description:
The maximum number of entries to return. Valid values: 1 to 500.\
Default value: 100.
The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. Set the value to the token that is obtained from the previous query.
The usernames of the convenience users.

items.description: The username of the convenience user.

schema.description: The serial numbers of the virtual MFA devices.

items.description: The serial number of the virtual MFA device. The serial number is unique for each device.

schema.description: The domain of the Active Directory (AD) workspace.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response parameters.

NextToken.description: The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results.

MfaDevices.title: mfa device list
MfaDevices.description: The information about the virtual MFA devices.

Id.description: >  This parameter is not publicly available.

EndUserId.description: The username of the convenience user that uses the virtual MFA device.

Email.description: >  This parameter is not publicly available.

GmtEnabled.description: The time when the virtual MFA device was enabled. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.

GmtUnlock.description: The time when the locked virtual MFA device was automatically unlocked. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format. The time is displayed in UTC.

ConsecutiveFails.description: The number of consecutive failures to bind the virtual MFA device, or the number of authentication failures based on the virtual MFA device.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of the virtual MFA device. The serial number is unique for each device.

Status.description:
The status of the virtual MFA device.

Valid values:

*   LOCKED

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

*   UNBOUND

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

*   NORMAL

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

    <!-- -->

DeviceType.description: The type of the virtual MFA device. The value can only be TOTP_VIRTUAL. This value indicates that the virtual MFA device follows the Time-based One-time Password (TOTP) algorithm.

DescribeMfaDevices.title: DescribeMfaDevices
